text: Autodesk started its business almost 30
years ago making desktop software
evolved into software services hosted in
brick-and-mortar data centers and
approximately seven years ago we
embarked on our journey to the cloud we
don't we don't think of AWS as a cloud
compute company we think of AWS as a
managed services company because of the
scope and breadth of managed services
they provide so we think of AWS support
as our virtual infrastructure support
team as if it was just another
department or group within Autodesk
because we know we can contact them with
no prior notice and get the levels of
support we need so that our customers
can get the quality of service that we
want them to have AWS support and and
all the manage services that they
support has provided a transformational
effect for our organization because we
don't have to think about architecting
every foundational service that we need
very often we can plug into the manage
services that AWS offers and save our
development teams countless cycles
developing something that's already
built and ready to use has AWS support
made made my job easier most definitely
there are some incident triage
situations that that my organization is
responsible for that would
next to impossible to get ourselves out
of without some direct intervention on
the part of AWS support I have you have
to have one negative experience and it's
not to say systems don't have issues at
times I mean it's it's the way that the
world works and but it's how how a
company responds and how they deal with
things and to that end it's always been
a positive experience if you need
support for your AWS infrastructure
solution you should give serious
consideration to hate to be low support
I mean it's that simple it's it it
almost seems self-evident to me I would
have never predicted the kind of direct
personal level of attention I mean I'm
sure that Autodesk has a fairly robust
support agreement but still I've had
experience with other companies that
have had fairly high level support
agreements never seen that kind of
direct personal involvement
Tam's that we work with from AWS support
are just amazing very dedicated
